author: Travis Simpson (noreply@couriernews.com)
title: RJHS falls on Colors Day
text: slideshow The Russellville Whirlwinds had opportunities during their 24-14 loss to the Cabot South Junior Panthers on Thursday at Cyclone Stadium on Colors Day.Russellville (3-3, 1-2 River Valley Central Conference) received the football to start the third quarter with work to do. The Whirlwinds trailed 16-7 and moved the ball deep into Junior Panthers territory, but a fumble set up Cabot on its 20-yard line. The Junior Panthers were unable to score, and Russellville had its second opportunity to put the game in reach.Whirlwinds quarterback Rhett Adkins connected for 19 yards on two consecutive pass plays. Drake Adkins picked up nine on the ground, before Rhett's pass was picked off by a Cabot defender. The Junior Panthers didn't hesitate to capitalize. Cabot marched 68 yards in seven plays to make it 24-7 with 5:24 left in the game.The Whirlwinds needed three scores â€” and fast. Rhett connected with Langston Parker for 15 and Bryson Kordsmeier for 32. A few plays later Russellville capped a 69-yard, seven-play drive with a 17-yard touchdown pass to Kordsmeier to set the final score.The Whirlwinds nipped the heels of the Junior Panthers throughout the first half. Russellville won the coin toss but deferred to the second half. Cabot wasted no time finding the end zone. The Junior Panthers scored on a three-play, 72-yard drive to go up 8-0 after the 2-point conversion.The Whirlwinds set up shop on their 46 after a pooch kick from Cabot. Russellville struggled for three plays, but a five-yard rush by Adkins and a pass interference penalty against the Junior Panthers made it first-and-10 on the Cabot 30.Adkins connected with cousin Drake Adkins near the right sideline for a 15-yard gain. Rhett picked up three more on the ground before tossing a 12-yard touchdown pass to Langston Parker to pull within 8-7 after the PAT kick with 4:03 left in the first quarter.After exchanging possessions, Cabot went up 16-7 on a 69-yard, five-play drive and successful 2-point conversion that left 4:16 to go in the half.The Whirlwinds went to work on their 33. Rhett connected on three passes for 30, 6 and 5 yards, but Russellville went cold deep in Junior Panthers territory. A field goal by by Rhett was ruled wide right.With just over two minutes left in the half, Cabot tried to score but fell short just past midfield.Cabot wracked up 378 yards rushing on 49 carries and 391 yards of total offense. Rhett Adkins rushed six times for 41 yards and was 12-or-28 for 175 yards and two touchdowns and one interception. Kordsmeier had four catches for 84 yards.Russellville will travel to Bryant on Thursday.
